xstream.cli

Interface Command

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCommand, ExitCommand, HelpCommand, RDDCommand

    public interface Command

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accepts(String line)
      affirms if the given command line can be processed by this command.
      void execute(String line, ExecutionContext ctx)
      executes this command
      String getArgument(int idx)
      gets argument at given index.
      String getDescription()
      gets detail description of function this command
      String getOption(String option)
      Gets value of the option as set by command line.
      String getUsage()
      gets short description to use this command
      int length()
      no of tokens for matching the command and ignore them at parse.
      String name()
      gets name of this command.
      void setArguments(String[] args)
      sets arguments to this command.
      void setOption(String option, String value)
      sets value of an option.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        gets name of this command.
        Returns:
        name of this command.

      • accepts

        boolean accepts(String line)
        affirms if the given command line can be processed by this command.
        Parameters:
        line - command line
        Returns:
        true if this command is recognized

      • setOption

        void setOption(String option,
               String value)
        sets value of an option. The command may not recognize this option.
        Parameters:
        option - option key
        value - value specified in command line

      • getOption

        String getOption(String option)
        Gets value of the option as set by command line.
        Parameters:
        option - option key
        Returns:
        value of the option

      • length

        int length()
        no of tokens for matching the command and ignore them at parse.
        Returns:
        number of tokens used in recognizing the command. mostly one.

      • getUsage

        String getUsage()
        gets short description to use this command
        Returns:
        a usage string

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        gets detail description of function this command
        Returns:
        a description string

      • setArguments

        void setArguments(String[] args)
        sets arguments to this command.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments from command line. The tokens that follow the options.

      • getArgument

        String getArgument(int idx)
        gets argument at given index.
        Parameters:
        idx - 0-based argument index
        Returns:
        value of an argument at given index

      • execute

        void execute(String line,
             ExecutionContext ctx)
      throws Exception
        executes this command
        Parameters:
        line - entire command line
        ctx - context of execution. the command should write output or error to this context.
        Throws:
        Exception - any exception to execute this command or illegal/ insufficient input
